Let's dive right in. Global warming refers to the gradual increase in the Earth's average temperature, primarily driven by human activities. Today, we'll explore the causes, effects, and most importantly, what we can do about it.

title: Definition of Global Warming
text: The gradual increase in the Earth's average temperature by human activities.
bullet: Causes
bullet: Effects
bullet: Solutions
image: Global warming

Convert a short part of a presentation script to presentation slide format seperated by newlines. You can only use titles (title), text (text), bullet points (bullet), and image descriptions (image). Script summary: A presentation on global warming and its consequences.

The roots of this issue lie in our daily activities. The burning of fossil fuels, rampant deforestation, industrial emissions, and certain agricultural practices contribute significantly to the increase in greenhouse gases.

title: Root Cause of Global Warming
bullet: The burning of fossil fuels
bullet: Rampant deforestation
bullet: Industrial emissions
bullet: certain agricultural practices
image: Fossil fuels

These gases, including carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide, create a greenhouse effect. They trap heat in the atmosphere, intensifying the Earth's natural warming process.

title:Greenhouse Gasses
bullet: carbon dioxide
bullet: methane
bullet: nitrous oxide
text: These gasses trap heat in the athmosphere and warm up the Earth.
image: Greenhouse gasses

The pythagorean theorem is a fundamental principle in geometry, solving the mysteries of right-angled triangles.

title: What is The Pythagorean Theorem?
text: A fundamental principle in geometry to solve right-angled triangles.

Convert a short part of a presentation script to presentation slide format seperated by newlines. You can only use titles (title), text (text), bullet points (bullet), and image descriptions (image). Script summary: A basic presentation on the pythagorean theorem.
In any right triangle, the square of the length of the hypotenuse, the side opposite the right angle is equal to the sum of the squares of the lengths of the other two sides.

title: Right Angled Triangles
text: square of the hypotenuse = sum of the squares of the other two sides.
